requirements.summary: Build calculator UI with display, digit buttons, operators, equals, and clear functionality that calls backend arithmetic functions
acceptanceCriteria: Display shows current input and results
Digit buttons append digits to the current input
Operator buttons select the operation and store the first operand
Equals button triggers the backend call and shows the result
Clear button resets the display and internal state
Division by zero displays an appropriate error message on screen

file_operations.description: Create the main Calculator component that renders the display and button grid. Implement state management for current input, stored operand, selected operator, and result. Wire digit buttons (0-9) to append to input, operator buttons (+, -, ร, รท) to store operand and operation, equals button to call backend methods (add, subtract, multiply, divide) via the backend actor, and clear button to reset state. Handle division by zero by checking the backend response and displaying an error message when divide returns an error.
Import and render the Calculator component as the main content of the application, replacing any placeholder content.

requirements.summary: Apply dark charcoal background, white display text, bold operator accent colors, minimal sans-serif typography, and centered card-style layout
acceptanceCriteria: Calculator is centered both vertically and horizontally on the page
Dark charcoal (#1e1e1e or similar) background is used
Operator buttons have a distinct accent color differing from digit buttons
Typography is clean and legible at all button sizes
Layout is consistent and visually cohesive

file_operations.description: Set the body background to dark charcoal (#1e1e1e or similar) and configure default text color for legibility. Ensure the root element fills viewport height to support vertical centering.

Extend the Tailwind theme to include custom color tokens for the calculator: a dark charcoal background color, white/light text for the display, a bold accent color for operator buttons (e.g., orange or blue), and a neutral gray for digit buttons. Configure minimal sans-serif font family as the default.

Apply Tailwind utility classes using the custom theme tokens to center the calculator card on the page (flexbox centering on parent container), style the display with white text on a slightly darker inset area, style digit buttons with the neutral gray background, and style operator buttons with the bold accent color. Ensure consistent spacing, border radius, and shadow for the card-style layout.
